articles.description: Follow the latest football news on transfer deadline day in the Women's Super League, plus build-up to Saturday's return of the Premier League.
articles.title: WSL transfer deadline day and Premier League build-up

articles.description: Ben Stokes was due to be playing golf at the PGA Championship this week, instead he teed off against New Zealand and put the rest of the world on notice, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: 'Stokes tees off to put rest of world on notice'

articles.description: England's Harry Maguire says the reaction from the Scotland fans in Tuesday's friendly at Hampden Park is just a "little bit of banter".
articles.title: Maguire says he can 'deal with' Scotland 'banter'

articles.description: Watch the best shots as Ben Stokes hits the highest score by an England batter in a one-day international by hammering 182 against New Zealand at The Kia Oval.
articles.title: Stokes hits England ODI record 182 - best shots

articles.description: Dave Cherry is "hugely disappointed" after pulling out of Scotland's World Cup squad, Stuart McInally taking his place.
articles.title: McInally replaces Cherry after hotel stairs slip

articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC Test Match Special commentary as England Women host Sri Lanka Women in the third ODI at Leicester.
articles.title: England v Sri Lanka, third ODI – toss delayed by rain

articles.description: The case had centred on claims of inequality compared to the men's team in areas such as facilities, travel and pay.
articles.title: Scottish team captain has withdrawn dispute with SFA

articles.description: Manchester United sign World Cup-winning Spain midfielder Irene Guerrero from Atletico Madrid.
articles.title: Man Utd sign Spain World Cup winner Guerrero

articles.description: Billy Vunipola is back, Wales look to lay down a marker, and Sam Whitelock will equal a record - what to look out for in week two of the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: What to look out for in week two of Rugby World Cup

articles.description: Cricket Australia brings in new rules which will require batters to wear neck protectors on their helmets when facing fast or medium bowling.
articles.title: Cricket Australia makes neck protectors compulsory
